description:
SpongeBob SquarePants is a TV game with 5 built in games.

Bubble Pop - The player controls SpongeBob and has to bounce a ball off of his head to pop bubbles. This very similar to Breakout.

Sandy's Surf Adventure - The player controls Sandy flying on a clam. This game is like Gradius.

Invasion of the hooks - The player controls SpongeBob who has to save his friends from being raised off screen from hooks. This game is like Missile Command

Patrick and the Maze - Patrick must journey through a coral maze to find his friends and a pearl, once finding one of these things the player must play a mini game involving clams.

The Super Chum Bucket - The player plays as SpongeBob and must go through platforming levels to reach Plankton.
title: Spongebob Squarepants

description:
The Walking Dead: Zombie Hunter is a rail shooter based on the television series. The game is built into a light gun shoot gun which is used to aim at and shoot zombies from a first-person perspective. Like in other rail shooters movement is automatic and the player simply has to shoot the zombies as they appear. Like in the series and the comic book, head shots are required to kill the zombies and sometimes multiple hits are required. Civilians will also appear and these can be saved by shooting the zombies that surround them. It's import to avoid hitting the civilians since it leads to points being lost. Shooting crates will reveal different items such as health packs, new weapons and ammunition and these are collected when shot. There are also barrels which will blow up when shot.

The game contains a story mode, a horde mode and a free play mode. The story mode has three acts with a number of scenes in each. Each scene has a primary objective that usually involves reaching a location and a bonus objective, for instance getting a number of head shots in a row. The horde mode simply involve surviving as long as possible against an endless amount of zombies. Free play mode allows the player to replay the scenes without having to play through the whole story mode. The game also contains a two player mode where zombies can take multiple hits and the aim is to get the final shot on a zombie.
title: The Walking Dead: Zombie Hunter

description:
Ping-O-Tronic is a dedicated console that has three modes: Tennis, which plays like Pong, Squash, which is a single player variant of Tennis, and Attract, which simply lets the ball bounce forever by setting the paddles to fill the entire screen.

Players can set the size of the paddles to determine the difficulty.
title: Ping-O-Tronic

description:
Using hardwired controllers, two players face off in Nintendo's take on the table tennis genre. The main objective is to bounce a ball off your paddle, and past your opponent's to score points. Unlike some of its 1970's contemporaries, Color TV-Game 15 allowed users to switch between a variety of game modes including, Tennis, Hockey, Volleyball, Ping Pong and "Shooting Game." While most of the games were very similar to each other, some such as Hockey, added obstacles that the ball could ricochet off of. Additionally users can adjust the speed of the game and the size of the individual paddles for a more customized experience.

Color TV-Game 15V is the second release of the Color TV-Game 15, following the Color TV-Game 15S. The 15V version can be identified by it's red color. The original 15S was yellow. Other than color there were some minor improvements. The size of the control nobs was increased slightly and they were modified to limited rotation. This was done to fix an issue with the first model where players could easily move their paddles off screen and get lost.
title: Color TV-Game 15V

description:
Bildschirmspiel 01 is a dedicated console with 4 built in games. The Bildschirmspiel 01 is the only game console made in the GDR. In every game players control a paddle represented by a white line. As opponents, except for the game Pelota, a second teammate was used. Playing against the computer was not possible. The included games are:

  • Pelota

  • Squash

  • Fussball

  • Tennis
title: Bildschirmspiel 01

description:
Super Pong is the second dedicated Pong console released by Atari. It contains four variations of the game:

  • Catch is a version of Pong where instead of hitting the ball with the paddle, the goal is to catch it in the gap between two long bars.

  • Solitaire is a one player game where there is a wall on the right side of the screen and the goal is to hit the hole located above the wall. The difficulty can be adjusted by increasing the height of the wall.

  • Super Pong is like the original Pong but each player controls two paddles.

  • Pong is identical to the original Pong game.

In all games the aim is to first reach a score of fifteen.
title: Super Pong

The Telstar Ranger/Marksman is a dedicated console playing various variations on Pong and two light-gun shooting games. It is a more advanced version of the Telstar. Included game modes are:

  • Jai-Alai (Squash in Telstar Sportsman release)
  • Hockey (Football in Telstar Sportsman release)
  • Handball
  • Tennis
  • Skeet
  • Target

All games are played by two players using dials on paddles. The Marksman release features color. The Ranger features a revolver, while the Marksman features a pistol with a detachable stock and barrel.
title: Telstar Ranger

description:
The Telstar Alpha/Colormatic/Regent/Colortron is a dedicated console playing various variations on Pong. It's a more advanced version of the Telstar. Included game modes are:

  • Jai-Alai
  • Hockey
  • Handball
  • Tennis

All games are played by two players using dials on paddles, except for the Alpha and Colortron releases where the dials are on the console itself. The game features three skill levels which determine the ball speed and paddle size.

The Colormatic and Colortron releases features colour graphics.
title: Telstar Alpha

description:
Using hardwired controllers, two players face off in Nintendo's take on the table tennis genre. The main objective is to bounce a ball off your paddle, and past your opponent's to score points. Unlike some of its 1970s contemporaries, Color TV-Game 15 allowed users to switch between a variety of game modes including, Tennis, Hockey, Volleyball, Ping Pong and "Shooting Game."

While most of the games were very similar to each other, some such as Hockey, added obstacles that the ball could ricochet off of. Additionally users can adjust the speed of the game and the size of the individual paddles for a more customized experience.

The Color TV-Game 15S is the first release of the Color TV-Game 15 and is predominantly yellow. A second, revised version of the CTG15, known as the 15V, had minor improvements and can be easily distinguished from the original by its dark orange/red color.
title: Color TV-Game 15S

description:
Telstar Combat! is a dedicated console playing four variations on the game Tank. The included game modes are:

  • Combat
  • Night Battle
  • Robot Battle
  • Camouflage Combat

Each player has two joysticks which are used to activate the individual tank threads and allow them to move their tank around the battlefield from a top down perspective. Barricades on the battlefield don't stop the tanks, but do block shots. Tanks can shoot guided missiles and must avoid mines.
title: Telstar Combat!

description:
The Telstar Galaxy dedicated console features 6 different Pong variants in colour display:

  • Tennis
  • Football
  • Hockey
  • Soccer
  • Basketball
  • Handball

The game supports up to four players with two paddles with a joystick and two additional dials on the console itself. Different settings for ball speed, auto serving and paddles sizes allow for 48 different combinations.
title: Telstar Galaxy

  • Hockey

Players can adjust the settings of the game, including the center line position and ball speed. Each player has three knobs, one controlling vertical position, one horizontal and one allowing to adjust the ball's trajectory. The game does not keep score.

  • Smash

Players can adjust the settings of the game, including the center line position and ball speed. Each player has three knobs, one controlling vertical position, one horizontal and one allowing to adjust the ball's trajectory. Unlike the Odyssey 100 the game does keep score.

The games can be played with either two or four players as a first for consoles.

description:
The Odyssey 300 is a dedicated console that plays three variants of Pong:

  • Tennis
  • Hockey
  • Smash

Unlike the Odyssey 200 the game displays the score using numbers, and three difficulty levels are introduced.
title: Odyssey 300

description:
The Odyssey 400 is a dedicated console that plays three variants of Pong:

  • Tennis
  • Hockey
  • Smash

Players can adjust the settings of the game, including the center line position and ball speed. Each player has three knobs, one controlling vertical position, one horizontal and one allowing to adjust the ball's trajectory. Unlike the Odyssey 200 the game displays score using numbers and serving happens automatically. It does not include the difficulty settings from the Odyssey 300.

The games can be played with either two or four players.
title: Odyssey 400

description:
The Odyssey 500 is a dedicated console that plays four variants of Pong:

  • Tennis
  • Hockey
  • Smash
  • Soccer

Players can adjust the settings of the game, including the center line position and ball speed. Each player has three knobs, one controlling vertical position, one horizontal and one allowing to adjust the ball's trajectory. Unlike the Odyssey 200 the game displays score using numbers and serving happens automatically. It does not include the difficulty settings from the Odyssey 300. The major difference from the Odyssey 400 is the addition of simple graphics to represent the different game elements and a fourth game (Soccer), which is functionally identical to Hockey, but features some the player graphics from smash.

The games can be played with either two or four players.
title: Odyssey 500

description:
Star Wars: Clone Trooper is a light-gun game based on the popular saga from George Lucas.

The game is a rail shooter, in which you shoot at battle droids and at some shield generators. There also some bosses like Count Dooku and the other villains.
title: Star Wars: Clone Trooper

description:
Star Wars: Clone Trooper Blaster Game is a light-gun game based on the popular saga from George Lucas.

The game is a rail shooter, in which you shoot at battle droids and use the directional pad to move. You can also throw grenades at your enemies.
title: Star Wars: Clone Trooper Blaster Game

description:
Star Wars: Blaster Strike is a light-gun game based on the popular saga from George Lucas.

You are the one and only Han Solo. In this game, you battle the enemies through 9 epic stages, fight for the victory and defeat the Galactic Empire.
title: Star Wars: Blaster Strike

description:
Star Wars: Republic Squadron is a light-gun game based on the popular saga from George Lucas.

The game is a rail shooter, in which you fight the enemies through five campaigns, each of which has 21 missions. You'll need to complete the first four campaigns in order to unlock the fifth.

sample_screenshots.caption: Feels like flying through the Death Star...
3rd person ground combat in the city

title: Star Wars: Republic Squadron

description: Star Wars: Lightsaber Battle Game is a plug and play TV game with a wireless lighsaber controller. In this game, you need to battle your enemies throug eight stages, and at the end, you fight Darth Vader.
title: Star Wars: Lightsaber Battle Game

description:
Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith is a compilation of five mini-games based on Star Wars; Episode III, as follows:

  • Droid Invasion: As Obi-Wan, reflect the blaster bolts with his lightsaber.
  • Coruscant Attack: aboard a Jedi starfighter, shoot droid fighters.
  • Grievous Onslaught: as Anakin, try to to avoid droids and arrive to the goal.
  • Gunship Battle: with a Gunship, try to get the clone troopers to the droid's base.
  • Utapau Chase: as Obi-Wan on his giant lizard, try to avoid obstacles to reach General Grievous.

sample_screenshots.caption: Before a game starts, the plot and controls are explained to the player.

title: Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith

description:
Star Wars: Original Trilogy is a compilation of four mini-games based on Star Wars franchise:

  • Lightsaber Duel: As Luke Skywalker, train with your lightsaber skills - through the game, you can unlock other characters.

  • Red Leader: Aboard an X-Wing, destroy targets and travel to various goals.

  • Assault On Hoth: Shoot at AT-ST and AT-AT walkers, and with a help of a Rebel officer, destroy the Imperial Forces.

  • Battle Of Endor: As Princess Leia or Chewbacca, avoid obstacles and get to the final goal.
title: Star Wars: Original Trilogy

description:
The Odyssey 2000 is a dedicated console that plays three variants of Pong:

  • Tennis
  • Hockey
  • Smash

The console is very similar to the Odyssey 300, but offers a single player practice mode for the Smash game mode.
title: Odyssey 2000

description:
The Odyssey 3000 is a dedicated console that plays three variants of Pong:

  • Tennis
  • Hockey
  • Smash

The console offers a single player practice mode for the Smash game mode. The console is very similar to the Odyssey 2000, but features independent difficulty settings for ball speed, deflection angle and paddle size and comes with detachable paddles instead of controls on the console itself.
title: Odyssey 3000

description:
Tectoy's DVD Dancemachine DVT-F800 is a DVD player, a karaoke machine and a dedicated console all built in one single machine. It comes with one gamepad identical to the original SEGA Master System controller and a dance pad. It has 4 buit-in games, two played with the dance pad and two with the gamepad; each game has five songs and three difficulty levels. The included games are:

  • Let´s Dance: a dance game to be played by one or two players with the dance pad.
  • Movin': a singing and dance game for up to 4 players. In doubles, one player sings and the other dances according to the patterns shown on screen.
  • Rock Show: a game similar to Guitar Hero, but instead of using a guitar controller the player uses the gamepad to press the notes as they scroll down the screen.
  • Beat Game: a game for up to four players. In doubles, one player sings and the other plays the selected instrument (guitar, drums or keyboards) using the gamepad.
title: DVD Dancemachine DVT-F800

description:
The Odyssey 4000 is a dedicated console that plays six variants of Pong:

  • Tennis
  • Hockey
  • Smash
  • Socker
  • Gridball
  • Basketball

The console offers a single player practice mode for the Smash and Basketball game modes. The console was the last in the dedicated Odysseys series. It features independent difficulty settings for ball speed, deflection angle and paddle size and comes with detachable paddle with small joysticks instead of dials.

Unlike previous Odyssey consoles this one featured colour graphics.
title: Odyssey 4000

description:
The Odyssey 2001 is a dedicated console that plays three variants of Pong:

  • Tennis
  • Hockey
  • Smash

The Odyssey 2001 was released solely in Europe and features colour graphics. It was released around the same time as the Odyssey 4000, but does not sport the same amount of features or games.
title: Odyssey 2001

description:
The Odyssey 2100 is a dedicated console that plays six different games, most of them variants of Pong:

  • Tennis
  • Ice Hockey
  • Handball
  • Football (soccer)
  • Flipper (Pinball)
  • Wipe-Out (Breakout)

The Odyssey 2100 was released solely in Europe and features colour graphics. Each game allows for variant rules making a grand total of 23 unique games.
title: Odyssey 2100

description:
Color TV-Game 6 was the first console to be released by Nintendo. It features full colour graphics and allows users to play the following Pong variants:

  • Tennis
  • Hockey
  • Volleyball

Each game can be played either with one or two players (making 6 game modes total). Two versions of the game have been released Model 6S and Model 6V, but the only difference is the casing colour and the fact that the 6S runs on batteries.
title: Color TV-Game 6

description:
Color TV Game Racing 112 is a dedicated console that plays a top down racing game for one or two players. Players must overtake cars without crashing into anything to score points. The console features two paddles a steering wheel and a throttle lever.

Various game settings can be adjusted, ranging from zigzagging of opponent cars, collision of guard rail, number of opponents and road condition.
title: Color TV Game Racing 112

description:
APF: TV Fun - Model 401 is a dedicated console playing four variations of Pong:

  • (Table) Tennis
  • Hockey/Football
  • Squash
  • Singles Handball

Aside from handball, all games require two players. Three switches on the device determine bat size, ball speed and deflection angle. The game is controlled using the two knobs on the console and it has a built-in speaker.
title: APF: TV Fun - Model 401

description:
APF: TV Fun - Sportsarama is a dedicated console playing three variations of Pong and two light gun games:

  • Tennis
  • Hockey
  • Handball
  • Target Shoot
  • Skeet Shoot

Tennis and Handball can be played with one or two players. Hockey can be played with two or four players. Auto serve can be disabled or enabled. Aside from two knobs on the console itself there are two tube-shaped paddles with additional knobs. Unlike the APF: TV Fun - Model 401 the game features colour graphics. Target Shoot and Skeet shoot use the included light gun.
title: APF: TV Fun - Sportsarama

  • Memory
  • Mirror Mirror
  • Mr. Balls
  • Mya Master Mind
  • Naval Power
  • Panic Lift
  • Plumbing Contest
  • Skeleton Scale
  • Snake
  • Spider
  • T-Rex Memory Match
  • Wall-Breaking
  • Warehouse Keeper
  • Whack-A-Wolf
  • Yawning Triceratops
title: Sega Genesis Classic Game Console

description:
APF: TV Fun - Model 405 is a dedicated console playing four variations of Pong:

  • Two player Tennis
  • Two player Hockey
  • Two player Handball
  • One player Handball

Auto serve can be disabled or enabled. Unlike the APF: TV Fun - Model 401 the game features wired paddles instead of knobs on the console itself. It also has three instead of two difficulty settings. The Model 406 is identical but has colour graphics.
title: APF: TV Fun - Model 405

description: Relay Moe is a dedicated computer that can play Tic-Tac-Toe. The game doesn't require a TV as it has its own display. Each square of the three by three grid has a button for the player to select a square. Squares will light up green or red based on being selected by the player or computer. A green white or red light at the top of the display shows which player has won at the end of the game. The computer will alternate his difficulty to ensure the player can win about half of the matches.
title: Relay Moe

description:
Master System 3 is a SEGA Master System console on a chip. It comes with 131 built-in games and two six-button controllers (similar to Genesis/Mega Drive controllers). Most included games were previously released for the Master System, with one Game Gear port and several new games. The included games are:

  • 20 em 1 (20 games)
  • Acerte o Alvo
  • Action Fighter
  • Aerial Assault
  • Alex Kidd: High-Tech World
  • Alex Kidd in Miracle World
  • Alex Kidd in Shinobi World
  • Alex Kidd: The Lost Stars
  • Alien Syndrome
  • Aquaduto
  • Arqueiro
  • Astro Warrior / Pit Pot
  • Ataque dos Vermes
  • Aventuras na Floresta
  • Aztec Adventure
  • Baku Baku Animal
  • Bank Panic
  • Batalha Animal
  • Batalha no Mar
  • Battle Out Run
  • Black Belt
  • Bolas e Cores
  • Bolhas
  • Bombeiros
  • Bomber Raid
  • Bonanza Bros.
  • Bubble Bobble
  • Cava Cava
  • Chase H.Q.
  • Columns
  • Creature Capture
  • Cyber Shinobi
  • Domine o Território
  • Dominó
  • Double Target
  • Dr. Limpeza
  • Dragon Crystal
  • Enduro Racer
  • Eswat: City Under Siege
  • Fábrica de Chocolate
  • Fantasy Zone
  • Fantasy Zone II
  • Fantasy Zone: The Maze

  • Galactic Protector
  • Ghost House
  • Global Defense

  • Golden Axe

  • Memória Master

  • Minerador
  • My Hero
  • Nim
  • Os doze trabalhos de Jongo
  • Outsiders
  • Putt & Putter
  • Rainbow Islands
  • Rastan Saga

  • Satellite 7
  • Scramble Spirits
  • Secret Commando
  • Senha
  • Serpentes

  • Special Criminal Investigation

  • Super Space Invaders
  • Super Tennis

  • The New Zealand Story
  • The Ninja
  • Thunder Blade

  • World Grand Prix
  • World Soccer (Great Soccer 2)
title: Master System 3

description:
Sesame Street: Elmo's World - My First TV Fun & Games is a Plug n' Play TV game geared towards very young children. The device has only three buttons, two directions and a jump button. There is a total of five games to play. The games are based on the television series Elmo's World. The game uses 8-bit graphics and has a very small amount of music.* Dinner for Dorothy: this game is very similar to most "catch the falling object" games. You play as Dorothy and must catch food pellets by moving left and right.

  • Elmo's Sea Search: you play as Elmo, and you must catch letters in order to make the alphabet while swimming in the ocean. If you bump into an empty level, you lose a life. If you lose all three lives, it's game over.

  • Elmo's Super Soccer: you must prevent the ball from going into the goal while playing as Elmo, who is the goaltender. You have three directions you can move. If Elmo misses it, you lose a life. If you lose all three lives, it's game over.

  • Elmo's Shape Jump: in this game, you play as Elmo and must jump from one side to another. However, you must wait until all three of the shapes in the jumping area match, or otherwise you lose a life.

  • Elmo's Shape Match: this game is similar to Tangrams, where you must match shapes in the correct spots in order to make an object. If you guess the wrong shape, you lose a life and get to try again. If you manage to make a shape, the game shows you picture of the real object.
title: Sesame Street: Elmo's World - My First TV Fun & Games

description:
The Zone: Wireless Gaming is a Wii knockoff which is powered by a Sunplus SPG system-on-a-chip. The system itself is small and has an infrared receiver on the front, power and reset buttons, a 9 volt DC power input, a battery compartment for 4 AAA batteries, and a AV video and mono audio output. Despite having a DC input the European release of the system doesn't come with a power adaptor.

The two controllers that come with the system a styled to look similar to Wiimotes. They have a d-pad, A B Start and Select buttons, some rudimentary motion sensing functionality, a battery compartment for 3 AAA batteries, and 5 infrared emitters (one for each side of the controllers). The controllers have holes for a speaker near the B button, however no speaker (or even a space where a speaker can go) is contained inside.

The system contains 7 built-in sports games:

  • Bowling
  • Extreme Power Soccer
  • Fishing Master (PAL only)
  • Master Golf
  • Table Tennis
  • TV Boxing
  • VR Tennis: World Champ
  • World Series (USA only)

sample_screenshots.caption: A shot of Fishing Master, the seventh game from the PAL version of the console.

title: Zone: Wireless Gaming

alternate_titles.title: Nintendo Classic Mini: Super Nintendo Entertainment System

description:
The Super Nintendo Entertainment System: Super NES Classic Edition, known as the Nintendo Classic Mini: Super Nintendo Entertainment System (Europe/Australia) is a miniature replica of the Super Nintendo Entertainment System (SNES) with 21 pre-installed games running on emulation software, with the option to save data only.

Twenty games are playable immediately, whilst the 21st and last game Star Fox 2, unlocks after clearing the first level of the original Star Fox. This is the first global release of Star Fox 2 through legal means, besides bootlegs, on an official platform. This compilation also means the first PAL/European release for Earthbound and Super Mario RPG. The European release uses the US (NTSC) release title in it's menu. Of the twenty-one games in the compilation, five were USA (NTSC) / PAL specific and weren't available in the Japanese Nintendo Classic Mini: Super Famicom version:

  • Contra III: The Alien Wars
  • Donkey Kong Country
  • Earthbound
  • Final Fantasy III
  • F-Zero
  • Kirby Super Star
  • Kirby's Dream Course
  • The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past
  • Mega Man X
  • Secret of Mana
  • Star Fox
  • Star Fox 2 (exclusive to this release)
  • Street Fighter II Turbo
  • Super Castlevania IV
  • Super Ghouls 'N Ghosts
  • Super Mario Kart
  • Super Mario RPG: Legend of the Seven Stars
  • Super Mario World
  • Super Mario World 2: Yoshi's Island
  • Super Metroid
  • Super Punch-Out!!
title: Super Nintendo Entertainment System: Super NES Classic Edition

description: Electronic Ping Pong is a Pong-variant controlled with two paddles on the console. The console was only available as a kit which had to be self constructed. Later versions of the kit featured joysticks instead of paddles.
title: Electronic Ping Pong

description:
SSX Snowboarder is a game in the SSX series of snowboarding arcade/simulation games, which comes with a snowboard-shaped controller (controlled by both the player's feet) and a device which links the game to a television set.

The game has 4 tracks and 4 game modes (Showoff, Pipedream, Tokyo Megaplex, Time Challenge), and characters from SSX Tricky. However, only one character can be present in a single race, with the gameplay shown in 2D sprites. Like in other games of the series, the goal is to finish a race (sometimes within the set time limit) while performing stunts and tricks when opportunities present themselves.
title: SSX Snowboarder

description:
Overkall is a clone of the Magnavox Odyssey console, but features no cartridges, instead it has seven built in games:

  • Tenis (Tennis)
  • Futbol (Football)
  • Esqui (Ski)
  • Ataque submarino (Submarine)
  • Persecution (Cat and Mouse)
  • Carrera espacial (Analogic)
  • Ruleta (Roulette)
  • Tenis de Mesa (Table Tennis)

As with the original Odyssey games the console includes overlays for the TV and game boards.
title: Overkal

description: VideoSport Mk 2 is a Pong variant with three game modes. Tennis is a traditional Pong game where two players bounce a ball around with a paddle. Hitting the sides of the screen scores a point. Football works similar, but there's a goal (hole in the side wall) that must be hit. The last game is hole in the wall, where one of the two players controls not a paddle, but a hole in the wall.
title: VideoSport Mk 2

alternate_titles.title: Videomaster Home T.V. Game Mk. II

description: Videomaster Home T.V. Game is a Pong variant for two players with three game modes. Tennis is a classic Pong game where two players use their paddles to bounce the ball around the screen. Hitting the sides scores a point. Football works identically, except there are holes in the sides (goals) which need to be hit. Squash blocks off the right side so only on the left can be scored. The paddles in all games are square rather than rectangular.
title: Videomaster Home T.V. Game

description: Television Tennis is a Pong variant. Two players bounce a ball around the screen with their paddles. The player scores when the ball hits the other side of the screen. The game also features a single player practice mode where one side of the field has a paddle that spans the entire height of the screen.
title: Television Tennis

description: Videomaster Rally Home T.V. Game is a Pong variant with two different game modes: Tennis (Two player Pong with manual score keeping and no center line), and a mode where the right paddle is instead a line with a hole in it. The game's manual proposes three games that can be played with this game mode: Find The Gap (one of the paddles in a hole instead), Wall Game (as Find The Gap, but a second player moves the hole), Stonewaller (move the hole outside of the game space and use it as a practice or squash mode).
title: Videomaster Rally Home T.V. Game

alternate_titles.title: Videomaster Home T.V. Game Mk. III

description:
Videomaster Olympic Home TV Game is a Pong variant similar to Videomaster Rally Home T.V. Game with some additional features.

The first player can also be inverted to become a hole instead of a paddle. A "wobble" effect (automatic movement up and down) can be added to the second player to increase difficulty.

In the original release the score was to be kept manually with a metal ball and indents in the console. This feature was removed in the later release as Videomaster Home TV Game Mk. III. The MK. III allowed for an add-on circuit that featured on-screen scoring, flashing the winner's paddle/hole and playing audio from the TV rather than a built in speaker.
title: Videomaster Olympic Home TV Game

description: Name of the Game is a dedicated console that plays four different Pong variants (Tennis, Hockey, Squash and Handball), and two target shooting games with an optional electronic gun controller. The games can be played by up to four players.
title: Name of the Game

description: Name of the Game II is a dedicated console that plays four different Pong variants (Tennis, Hockey, Squash and Handball). The games can be played by two players. It is a stripped down version of Name of the Game.
title: Name of the Game II

description: Super Pong Ten is a successor to Super Pong and features ten different Pong variants rather than four. All game modes can be played by two players. The PRO-AM version allows for Professional and amateur difficulty settings.
title: Super Pong Ten

description:
Super Pong IV is the second dedicated Pong console. It features four player variants of the games found in Super Pong:

  • Catch is a version of Pong where instead of hitting the ball with the paddle, the goal is to catch it in the gap between two long bars.

  • Solitaire is a one player game where there is a wall on the right side of the screen and the goal is to hit the hole located above the wall. The difficulty can be adjusted by increasing the height of the wall.

  • Super Pong is like the original Pong but each player controls two paddles.

  • Pong is identical to the original Pong game.

In all games the aim is to first reach a score of fifteen.
title: Tele-Games: Super Pong IV

description:
Arcade Legends: Sega Genesis is a dedicated console unit that includes six ports of the following Genesis/Mega Drive games:

  • Sonic the Hedgehog
  • Altered Beast
  • Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine
  • Flicky
  • Golden Axe
  • Kid Chameleon
title: Arcade Legends: Sega Genesis

alternate_titles.description: Version with sliders and manual serve
alternate_titles.title: TV Scoreboard Model 60-3052

description: TV Scoreboard is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants: Squash (Sometimes named Handball), Tennis, Hockey and Practice. The game was released in various versions with slight differences: The controllers of the initial release feature levers instead of paddles. Another version had sliders on the console itself (not detachable). Settings include the amount of slice, paddle size and ball speed. Some releases had an additional option for automatic or manual serving.
title: TV Scoreboard

description: Full Color TV Scoreboard is dedicated console featuring various Pong variants. The games included are Hockey, Tennis and Handball. Each game can be played with one or two players. As the title suggests the game is in color. Each controller features a slider and a serve button.
title: Full Color TV Scoreboard

description: TV Scoreboard: 2&4 Player Plus Target is a dedicated console containing multiple Pong variants. The games included are: Tennis, Hockey, Target and Squash. Squash can be played with one or two players, Tennis and Hockey can be played by two to four players. The games are in color and feature settings for power, manual or automatic serve and a speed handicap per team. Score is kept with sliders on the device itself. The controllers feature sliders to control the on-screen paddles.
title: TV Scoreboard: 2&4 Player Plus Target

description: TV Scoreboard is a dedicated console with Pong variants and target shooting games. The games included are: Tennis, Hockey, Squash, Practice, Target and Skeet. Up to two players control the game using paddles and a light-gun in the case of the target shooting games. Settings include ball speed, bat size, slice amount and automatic or manual serve.
title: TV Scoreboard

description: Tele-Games: Hockey Pong is a dedicated console with four Pong variants. The games included are Hockey, Pong, Handball and Handball practice. There is no onscreen scoring and the players use paddles on the device itself.
title: Tele-Games: Hockey Pong

description: Tele-Games: Speedway IV is a dedicated console that combines a racing game (with two different tracks) with Pong variants. The pong variants are Hockey (up to two players) and Tennis (up to four players). Tennis and Hockey can also be played against a "Robot" (AI). Each player uses a paddle to control the on screen action. The game features full color.
title: Tele-Games: Speedway IV

description: Video Action VA-III is a dedicated console playing multiple Pong variants. The games are hockey and tennis. Both games can be played against a "Robot" (AI) which has variable difficulty (speed of its paddle).
title: Video Action VA-III

description: Gameroom Tele-Pong is Pong variant that plays pong for up to four players. There is no on-screen scoring, it has to be tracked manually on the console with sliders. Each player controls a paddle on the console.
title: Gameroom Tele-Pong

description: Video Sports is a dedicated console that plays Pong variants. Games include: Tennis, Hockey, Squash and practice. Two players use paddles to influence the ball and settings allow for different bat size, ball speed, angle and automatic/manual serve.
title: Video Sports

description: Face-Off is a dedicated console that plays two Pong variations. The games are hockey and soccer and both can be played in expert or novice mode. The paddles are controlled with joysticks on the device. Score is kept by separate LED displays on the device rather than on the screen.
title: Face-Off

description: TV Game is a collection of Pong variants. It uses the common AY-3-8500 Pong chip and the board was developed by the Hong Kong company E & P Electronic (HK) Ltd. under license of Magnavox. It was published by various companies. Games playable on the console are Tennis, Hockey, Squash and Practice. There are settings for bat size, manual serve, speed and angle.
title: TV Game EP500

description: Video Olympiad is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants. It uses the common AY-3-8500 Pong chip which features the following variants: Tennis, Hockey, Squash and Practice.
title: Video Olympiad

description: Superscore is a dedicated console playing Pong variants and some target shooting games with a light gun. It uses the common AY-3-8500 Pong chip. The games are Tennis, Hockey, Squash, Solo and two target shooting variants. The light gun was an optional accessory, but required for the shooting games. The console was sold both pre-assembled and in kit form so that users required manual assembly.
title: Superscore

description: Gamatic 7600 is a dedicated console that plays Pong variants. It uses the common TMS-1965 Pong chip and plays four variations: Tennis, Hockey/Football, Handball and Practice.
title: Gamatic 7600

description: Gamatic 7706 or Wonder Wizard Bulls Eye (Wonder Wizard Sharp Shooter (Color graphics version)) is a dedicated console playing various Pong variants and two target shooting games. The console uses the common AY-3-8500 chip which has the following games available: Jai Alai, Handball, Hockey, Tennis, Target and Skeet.
title: Gamatic 7706

description: TV-Ping-Pong is a dedicated console that plays Pong. The game can be played only with two players and the only setting is the ball speed. Players control their on screen paddles with sliders. There is sound but no on-screen scoring.
title: TV-Ping-Pong

description: Tele Sports is a dedicated console playing three Pong variants. The games are Tennis (2 or 4 player), Hockey (2 or 4 player) and Robot (1 or 2 players versus AI). The four player tennis variant actually uses split-screen to draw two tennis fields and lets four players play one on one simultaneously, which could be a unique feature in all Pong variants.
title: Tele Sports

description: Adversary is a dedicated console playing three Pong variants. The games are Tennis, Ice Hockey and Handball and use color graphics. The controllers uses levers to control the on-screen paddle. The games can be played solo or in one versus one. One game can be played against the AI.
title: Adversary: Model 370

description: Heathkit GD-1380 is a dedicated console playing 4 Pong variants and two target shooting games. It uses the common AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip. The console was sold as a kit for manual assembly. It hooks up directly to the television set's electronics and contains a manual detailing the process for various television kits sold by the same company. The games are Tennis, Squash, Hockey, Practice, Target 1 and 2. The Pong games are played with controllers with a lever, the target shooting game uses a light gun. Unlike most dedicated Pong consoles audio is played on the TV rather than a speaker on the device and it even has a volume control.
title: Heathkit GD-1380

alternate_titles.description: Conic release (color graphics, alternate detachable paddles)
alternate_titles.title: TV Sports TG-721

description: TVG 101-4 is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants. The console uses the common AY-3-8500 Pong chip. The games included are Tennis, Hockey, Squash and Handball. Settings allow for sound to be turned on or off, increased speed, deflection angle, bat size and automatic serve.
title: TVG 101-4

alternate_titles.title: Telematch Color TV Sports Video Game

description: Color TV Sports 406 is essentially the same console as TVG 101-4 but features all six games on the chip meaning that besides Hockey, Tennis, Squash and Handball it also plays two target shooting games using a light gun. The games use color graphics.
title: Color TV Sports 406

description: MEC TV Games Model TVG 2006 is a dedicated console playing various Pong variants. It uses the same circuit board as VideoSport Mk 2, but adds three additional games for a total of six games: Tennis, Football, Practice, Baseball, Basketball and Squash. None of the games have on-screen scoring.
title: MEC TV Games Model TVG 2006

description: Occitel is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants. It uses the common AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip which features four games: Tennis, Football, Squash and Exercise. Available settings are speed, bat size and automatic service.
title: Occitel

description: PP 2000 is a dedicated console playing two Pong variants. The games are Tennis/Ping-Pong and Pelote/Volley. The first is classic Pong, the other removes the center line and changes player two into a hole rather than a bat allowing single player play. There is no on-screen scoring.
title: PP 2000

description: Ricochet is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants in full color. The games are Tennis, Hockey, Ricochet (single player) and Three Wall Racquetball. The game features a bit more features than common for Pong games at the time. Both players have buttons for Pro Slam, Pro English and Manual Serve on their controller allowing for more advanced techniques.
title: Ricochet

description: Paddle IV is a dedicated console featuring four Pong variants. The game uses the AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip and features the following games: Tennis, Hockey, Squash and Practice.
title: Paddle IV

description: Paddle VI is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants and two target shooting game. It's the same console as the Paddle IV, but with all games on the AY-3-8500 chip unlocked and a light gun accessory included.
title: Paddle VI

description: Video TV Game is a dedicated console playing three different Pong variants in color graphics. The console uses the NTL-600 dedicated Pong chip. The games are Squash, Tennis and Soccer. Options include manual serve, three speeds, and automatic speed adjustments. The on screen paddles are controlled with sliders on the controllers.
title: Video TV Game

description: TV Challenger Series 2000 is a dedicated console playing three Pong variants The games are Tennis, Hole in the Wall and Holes in the Wall. In Hole in the Wall the paddles are inverted becoming holes in which the ball must be caught. The holes oscillate slightly to increase the challenge. There is no on-screen scoring, instead plastic chips are used on a score track on the device itself.
title: TV Challenger: Series 2000

description: Video Game TVG-5000 is a dedicated console playing multiple Pong variants and target shooting games. It uses the common AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip. The games are Tennis, Hockey, Squash, Practice and two target shooting games. There are settings for paddle size, automatic serve, ball speed and angle.
title: Video Game TVG-5000

description: Electrotennis is a dedicated console playing Pong for one (versus AI) or two players. The paddles can be moved in all directions using two paddles per player. It doesn't keep on the screen, but instead has dials on the console itself. The most unique part of the console is that it's completely wireless. It's powered by batteries and sends its video signal via a wireless TV signal which can be picked up by a TV.
title: Electrotennis

description: 2000 T.V. Game is a dedicated console playing three Pong variants. The games are Hockey, Tennis and Squash/Handball. There are settings for sound enabled or not and the size of the paddles. The speed of the game can be set using a analog dial rather than the common binary switch. The controllers have two paddles allowing for movement in all directions.
title: 2000 T.V. Game

description: Handi-Pong is a dedicated console playing two Pong variants. The games are handball and tennis. Both players can be replaced by AI, including having two AIs play each other. The on-screen paddles can move in all directions using two knobs. The only setting is the paddle size.
title: Handi-Pong

description: Sports King Model-101 is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants and two target shooting games. The games include Tennis/Ping Pong, Soccer/Hockey and Squash and two target shooting games which require an optional light gun accessory.
title: Sports King Model-101

description: Telesport is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants. The console uses the common AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip. The games are Solo Squash, Squash, Football and Tennis. There are settings for bat size, speed, and angle of return. Players use sliders on the console itself to control the on-screen paddles.
title: Telesport

description: Tournament 100 is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants. The console uses the AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip which features the following four games: Tennis, Hockey, Squash and Practice. Settings include bat size, manual serving, ball speed and rebound angle. The controllers feature a slider to move the paddle and a speed up button.
title: Tournament 100

description: Tournament 150 is a dedicated console that plays four Pong variants and two target shooting game. It's the same console as the Tournament 100 but with all games on the AY-3-8500 chip unlocked and featuring a light gun.
title: Tournament 150

description: Tele Multiplay is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants. The console features the following games: Hockey, Football, Tennis and Squash. They can be played with one or two players. Settings include rebound angle, speed and manual serve.
title: Tele Multiplay

alternate_titles.description: Plastic model with wired remote control
alternate_titles.title: Tele-Tainment III

description: Tele-Tainment II and models III and IV are dedicated consoles playing seven games, mostly Pong variants. The games are: Pin-Pong, Squash Handball, Basketball, Catch, Trapshoot, Zany Rebound and Krazy Catch. The device uses analog components and the different models feature different casings and paddles.
title: Tele-Tainment II

description: Pong is a dedicated console in unassembled format. It consist of some PC boards and ICs and must be assembled by the user using a detailed manual. The actual hardware allow for five different Pong variants. They include, Pong, Tennis, Four player Tennis and Soccer.
title: Pong

description: Pong Extras are instructions to add additional games to the Pong console by Advanced Electronics. The instructions add seven additional games using additional ICs. They include: Handball, Warball, Elimination, Fotsball. Also included are instructions for digital controlled paddles, multiple paddles and multiple balls.
title: Pong Extras

description: Anti-Aircraft 1 is a dedicated console playing a game very similar to Atari's Anti-Aircraft. The players control anti-aircraft guns at the bottom of the screen and must try to shoot down aircraft flying over at the top. A player controls the angle of fire and when to fire. The console is only available in unassembled format, it contains a set of ICs and PC boards and a manual detailing how to assemble it.
title: Anti-Aircraft 1

description: Anti-Aircraft 2 is a dedicated console. Similar to Anti-Aircraft 1 but slightly more complex as the aircraft being shot at by the players will try to outmanoeuvre the projectiles due to additional logic. The console is only available in unassembled format, it contains a set of ICs and PC boards and a manual detailing how to assemble it.
title: Anti-Aircraft 2

description: Jaws-2 is a dedicated console playing a game similar to Shark JAWS. Two players must try to catch a randomly moving fish without getting eaten by a roaming shark. The shark will home in on the nearest diver. The console is only available in unassembled format, it contains a set of ICs and PC boards and a manual detailing how to assemble it.
title: Jaws-2

description: Space Race is a dedicated console playing a game similar to Atari's Space Race. In the game the players control rockets that fly vertically along the screen and must avoid meteoroids the fly past horizontally. The console is only available in unassembled format, it contains a set of ICs and PC boards and a manual detailing how to assemble it.
title: Space Race

description: Basic TV Ping-Pong Game is an instruction set on how to build a dedicated console that features a basic Pong variant. Additional instructions allows for a 2 digit LED score display, sound feedback and a battery power supply.
title: Basic TV Ping-Pong Game

description: 6 TV Games On One Chip is a dedicated console sold in kit form featuring six games, two target shooting light-gun games and four Pong variants. The console uses the common AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip and after assembly can play all four games: Tennis, Soccer, Squash, Practice, Rifle game 1 and 2.
title: 6 TV Games on One Chip

description: Four-Play is a black and white TV set with a dedicated console built in. There are two Pong variant that can be played with two or four players. The games are Tennis and Soccer.
title: Four-Play

description: Ping-Pongtronics is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants. The console was offered in kit form for manual assembly. An optional accessory kit adds scoring, sound and automatic serve. The games are Ping-Pong, Gravity (as Ping-Pong, but side view with gravity), Handball (one player ping-pong) and Basketball (gap in the wall). Unique from most Pong games there's a larger range for ball speed and a slam button which increases the speed of the ball when bounced back. An "Aimshot" feature gives greater control on the return angle of the ball than most games. The two player games can also be played against the AI.
title: Ping-Pongtronics

description: Challenger is a dedicated console playing four different Pong variants. Included games are Tennis, Hockey and Squash. The games can be played with two players and sound is directed through the TV rather than emitted from a speaker in the console. Options include two speed settings and different paddle sizes.
title: Challenger

description: Video Sports 76 is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants. The console uses the common AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip which features the following games: Tennis, Hockey, Smash, Handball. Settings allow for changing game speed and deflection angle.
title: Video Sports 76

description: Video Game Kit is a dedicated console available in kit form. The console plays five different Pong variants. The games are: Match (Tennis), Match Pro (three paddles per player), Gravity Match (Tennis with gravity in a side view), Wipe Out (remove all blocks from the screen), Wipe Out II (two player variant).
title: Video Game Kit

description: Professional Video Game is a dedicated console in kit form for manual assembly. The console plays four Pong variants. It plays only one game mode, but it can be played with one player versus AI, two players against each other, three players against the AI or four players against each other. The three and four player modes use a square playing field in which two of the players use the top and bottom of the screen.
title: Professional Video Game

description: Tournament 1000 is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants. The console uses the common AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip. The games included are Tennis/Table Tennis, Hockey/Soccer, Squash and Practice. Settings include paddle size, ball speed, return angle and manual or automatic serve. Scoring is kept on the device using sliders.
title: Tournament 1000

description: Tournament 2000 is a dedicated console. It's identical to the 1000 model except that it plays all games on the AY-3-8500 chip, which means it also plays the two target shooting games with the included light gun.
title: Tournament 2000

description:
Star Trek Phaser Battle is a tabletop electronic game in which the player must shoot down Klingon ships. The player controls the phasers of his ship using a joystick which moves a targeting line left and right across the screen. The button on the joystick fires the phasers. The player can be hit several times before his ship is destroyed, represented by outer and inner shields. The player can activate deflector shields on port or starboard to prevent getting hit by enemy missiles.

There are three game speeds to switch between.
title: Star Trek Phaser Battle

alternate_titles.title: Electronic Color TV Game Model Q 476

description: Electronic Color TV Game Model Q 376 is a dedicated console that plays four Pong variants. The console uses the common AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip which features the following games: Tennis, Hockey, Handball and Smash. The games are in color, there are settings for ball speed, paddle size and deflection angle. Model Q 376 features dials on the device to control the paddles, the Q 476 features sliders on wired controllers.
title: Electronic Color TV Game Model Q 376

description: Super Smash is a dedicated console sold in kit form playing two Pong variants. The games are Tennis (Pong) and Bumper. In Bumper a giant square sits in the middle of the screen. When hitting the vertical edges of the bumper makes the ball bounce back at a randomized speed and angle. Hitting the top or bottom makes the ball enter the bumper and exit it with a random speed and angle. The game uses on-screen scoring.
title: Super Smash

description: Space War Game is a dedicated console available only in kit format for manual assembly. The game is for two players who both control a white square representing a space ship. The ships can only move vertically. Players can fire a laser in a direct horizontal line. When hit a player loses, but when a shot misses the firing player has to reload for some seconds during which he or she cannot fire back and is thus vulnerable.
title: Space War Game

description:
THEC64 Mini is a dedicated console that looks like a miniature Commodore 64 computer. The keyboard on the console is decorative (non-functional) and the included joystick is used as an interface, but adding a USB keyboard enables the system to function as a home computer with C64 BASIC.

The system has 64 games built in. The games included are:

  • AlleyKat
  • Anarchy
  • Armalyte: Competition Edition
  • Avenger
  • Battle Valley
  • Bounder
  • California Games
  • Chip’s Challenge
  • Confuzion
  • Cosmic Causeway: Trailblazer II

description:
The Weekly Shōnen Jump 50th Anniversary Version edition of the Nintendo Classic Mini: Family Computer is a special golden edition, only released in Japan, to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the shōnen manga Weekly Shōnen Jump and comes with 20 pre-installed games based on various Weekly Shōnen Jump properties:

Captain Tsubasa:

  • Captain Tsubasa
  • Captain Tsubasa II: Super Striker

Dragon Ball:

  • Dragon Ball 3: Gokūden
  • Dragon Ball Z: Kyōshū! Saiyajin
  • Dragon Ball: Shenron no Nazo

Dragon Quest:

  • Dragon Quest

Famicom Jump:

  • Famicom Jump: Eiyuu Retsuden
  • Famicom Jump II: Saikyou no 7-nin

Fist of the North Star:

  • Hokuto no Ken
  • Hokuto no Ken 3: Shinseiki Sōzō Seiken Retsuden

Kinnikuman:

  • Kinnikuman: Kinnikusei Oui Soudatsusen
  • Kinnikuman: Muscle Tag Match

Saint Seiya:

  • Saint Seiya: Ōgon Densetsu
  • Saint Seiya: Ōgon Densetsu - Kanketsu Hen

Others

  • Ankoku Shinwa: Yamato Takeru Densetsu
  • Destiny of an Emperor
  • Magical Tarurūto-kun: Fantastic World!!
  • Rokudenashi Blues
  • Sakigake!! Otokojuku Shippuu Ichi Gou Sei
  • Sekiryuuou
title: Nintendo Classic Mini: Family Computer (Weekly Shōnen Jump 50th Anniversary Version)

description:
Ultra Pong is a dedicated console featuring 16 Pong variants. The games feature color graphics and allow play for two players. The games are:

  • Pong
  • Super Pong
  • Hyper Pong
  • Ultra Pong
  • Hockey
  • Super Hockey
  • Hyper Hockey
  • Ultra Hockey
  • Barrier Pong
  • Super Barrier Pong
  • Hyper Barrier Pong
  • Ultra Barrier Pong
  • Barrier Hockey
  • Super Barrier Hockey
  • Hyper Barrier Hockey
  • Ultra Barrier Hockey

The different versions are all iterative adding elements such as multiple paddles (in your own half of the screen or the other player's), goals and barriers.
title: Ultra Pong

description:
Ultra Pong is a dedicated console featuring 16 Pong variants. The games feature color graphics and is a four player version of Ultra Pong. The games are:

  • Pong
  • Super Pong
  • Hyper Pong
  • Ultra Pong
  • Hockey
  • Super Hockey
  • Hyper Hockey
  • Ultra Hockey
  • Barrier Pong
  • Super Barrier Pong
  • Hyper Barrier Pong
  • Ultra Barrier Pong
  • Barrier Hockey
  • Super Barrier Hockey
  • Hyper Barrier Hockey
  • Ultra Barrier Hockey

The different versions are all iterative adding elements such as multiple paddles (in your own half of the screen or the other player's), goals and barriers.
title: Ultra Pong Doubles

description: Stunt Cycle is the home console version of Its Arcade predecessor. The game console features motorbike handlebars as a controller and features four different game modes. Stunt Cycle plays as the Arcade game. The player is tasked to jump over buses, after each successful jump the number of buses is increased up to 32. Drag race does not have any jumps the player must try to go as fast as possible without flipping over. Enduro has obstacles before the jump and Motocross is a race against the clock. The game features colored graphics.
title: Stunt Cycle

description: Tele-Games Electronic Games: Motocross Sports Center IV is a dedicated console combining all games found in the Atari consoles Ultra Pong Doubles and Stunt Cycle allowing for 20 game modes in all: 16 Pong variants and four motorcycle stunt racing games.
title: Tele-Games Electronic Games: Motocross Sports Center IV

description:
Adversary: Model 600 is a dedicated console that plays six different games in 23 variants, most of them variants of Pong:

  • Tennis
  • Ice Hockey
  • Handball
  • Football (soccer)
  • Pinball
  • Wipe-Out (Breakout)
title: Adversary: Model 600

description: TV Game 2000K is a dedicated console playing three Pong variants and one target shooting game. The games can be played with up to four players and features settings for skill level (either side of the fence), manual or automatic serve, two or four player mode (for the pong variants) and moving or skeet shooting for the target shooting game. The console is based on the MOS Technologies MPS 7601 dedicated pong chip. The target shooting game uses a lightgun.
title: TV Game 2000K

description:
Video Pinball is a dedicated console playing various Pinball games and Breakout variants. The games are:

  • Flipper Pinball 1
  • Flipper Pinball 2
  • Paddle Pinball 1
  • Paddle Pinball 2
  • Rebound
  • Breakout
  • Breakthru

The games can be played in color and with one or two players. A brown and cream version exists for the Atari release.
title: Video Pinball

description: Video Mate TV Jack 1000 is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants for one and two players. The games are: Hockey, Racquetball, Tennis and Practice.
title: Video Mate TV Jack 1000

description: Video Mate TV Jack 1200 is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants for up to four players. The games are: Hockey, Racquetball, Tennis and Practice. Aside from the larger number of players and the two additional paddles on the device the games are otherwise identical to the Video Mate TV Jack 1000.
title: Video Mate TV Jack 1200

description: Video Mate TV Jack 1500 is a dedicated console playing eight Pong variants for one or two players. The games are: Hockey, Racquetball, Tennis, Tennis Practice, Football, Basketball, Basketball Practice and Gridball. The console uses the AY-3-8610 dedicated pong chip.
title: Video Mate TV Jack 1500

description: Video Mate TV Jack 2500 is a dedicated console playing four arcade combat games. Each game (Space War, Phantom War, Space Phasor, Phantom Phasor) pits two combatants against each other. Both can move their space ship up and down and fire missiles. Different moving and stationary objects flying across the screen add difficulty in hitting the opponent. Each of the four different games can be played in five different difficulties.
title: Video Mate TV Jack 2500

description: Video Mate TV Jack 3000 is a dedicated console featuring two top down racing games and two Pong variants. The pong games are Tennis and Hockey and can be played in multiple different variants. All games can be played with up to four players and all are played with just a paddle.
title: Video Mate TV Jack 3000

alternate_titles.title: Compact Color TV Game Model: T-802 C

description: TV Game Model: T-800 is a dedicated console that plays four Pong variants. The console uses the AY-3-8500 pong on a chip. The games are Tennis, Hockey, Squash and Solo. One or two players play against each other using wired paddles. There are settings for deflection angle, speed, bat size and automatic or manual serve. The game was released in multiple slight casing variations and both a monochrome and color version.
title: TV Game Model: T-800

description: N20 is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants and two target shooting games. The console uses the common AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip. The games are Tennis, Football, Squash, Practice, Skeet and Target shooting. There are settings for speed, angle of deflection, paddle size, manual of automatic serve.
title: N20

description: Tele-Sports Mini is a dedicated console featuring four Pong variants. The console uses the common AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip and plays Tennis, Hockey, Squash and Practice. Settings allow toggling between bat size, ball deflection angle and ball speed. The mini part of its name comes from the fact that all the logic is inside the controllers in the players' hands. There's no additional console.
title: Tele-Sports Mini

description: TV-Action Color 200 is a dedicated console with eight Pong variants. It uses the same small form factor as the Tele-Sports Mini but uses the AY-3-8610 dedicated pong chip. It plays all pong games on the chip, but not the shooting games. The games are: Tennis, Squash, Pelota, Hockey, Kicker (Gridball), Basketball (1 player), Basketball (2 players) and Football. Settings allow for speed, deflection angle and paddle size.
title: TV-Action Color 200

description: Grandstand Model: 5000 Colour Video TV Game is a dedicated console featuring four Pong variants, four racing games and two target shooting games. The console uses the AY-3-8500 and AY-3-8760 dedicated pong chips. The games are Motor Cross, Enduro, Drag Race, Stunt Cycle, Practice, Squash, Soccer, Tennis, Target and Moving Target. All the racing games are side view motor racing games some of which require jumping over a number of buses.
title: Grandstand Model: 5000 Colour Video TV Game

description: Sportron 101 is a dedicated console featuring four Pong variants. The console uses the common AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip but plays only the four pong variants (hockey/football, tennis, squash and practice). Settings switch bat size, manual or automatic serve, speed, deflection angle and sound on or off.
title: Sportron 101

description: Sportron 105 is a dedicated console featuring four Pong variants and two target shooting games. The console uses the common AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip featuring the following games: hockey/football, tennis, squash, practice, target and skeet shooting. Settings switch bat size, manual or automatic serve, speed, deflection angle and sound on or off.
title: Sportron 105

description: Sportron 108 is a dedicated console playing eight Pong variants. The game uses the AY-3-8610 dedicacted pong chip but only allows play of the pong variants. The games are: Football, Hockey, Handball, Handball Practice, Tennis, Basketball, Basketball Practice and Gridball. Settings swap betweenr manual or automatic service, bat size, deflection angle and speed. Paddles can move in all directions.
title: Sportron 108

description: GT-10C is a dedicated console playing eight Pong variants and two target shooting games. The console uses the AY-3-8610 dedicated pong chip and features the following games: Football, Hockey, Handball, Handball Practice, Tennis, Basketball, Basketball Practice, Gridball, Skeet and Target Shooting. Settings swap between manual or automatic service, bat size, deflection angle and speed. Paddles can move in all directions.
title: GT-10C

description: Sportron 201 is a dedicated console playing three color Pong variants. The games are Hockey, Tennis and Squash. Each game can be played in practice or two player mode. There are no further options.
title: Sportron 201

description: Champion Deluxe is a four player version of Sports King Model-101. It plays the same six games from the General Instruments AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip. The light gun needed for the two target shooting games needs to be bought separately.
title: Champion Deluxe

description: TV-Games M-020-5 is a dedicated console that plays five Pong variants. The games are: Hockey, Table Tennis and Squash, plus a practice mode and a single player mode for Hockey. The console was released in multiple shapes and colors and features settings for deflection angle, ball speed and bat size. Serving is done automatically.
title: TV-Games M-020-5

description: TVG-204 is a dedicated console. It's shaped like the TVG 101-4, but it plays only three games: Tennis, Hockey and Handball. And features only limited settings. The games use color graphics.
title: TVG-204

description: 4 Electronic TV Sport Games EP800 is a dedicated console which plays four Pong variants. Like its predecessor the EP500 the games are Tennis, Hockey, Squash and Practice. However instead of the General Instruments AY-3-8500 the Texas Instruments TMS-1955 dedicated pong chip is used. This iteration of the console also features detachable paddles rather than them being on the console itself.
title: 4 Electronic TV Sport Games EP800

description: TV Fun: Color Model 501 is the first TV Fun dedicated console released only in Japan. The console plays three Pong variants: Hockey, Tennis and Squash. Games use color visuals and allow for two players.
title: TV Fun: Color Model 501

description: TV Fun: Color Model 602 is a dedicated console playing three Pong variants for four players. The games are Tennis, Hockey and Squash and are played with color graphics.
title: TV Fun: Color Model  602

description: TV Fun: Color Model 701 is a dedicated console that plays eight different Pong variants. The console uses the AY-3-8600 dedicated pong chip which features the following games: Tennis, Hockey, Soccer, Squash, Practice, Gridball, Basketball and Basketball Practice. The games are played in color.
title: TV Fun: Color Model 701

description: TV Fun: Color Model 901 is a dedicated console that combines two chips by general instruments, the AY-3-8500 and AY-3-8765. This allows the console to play four variations of motocross and four Pong variants. The motocross games use a side view showing the motor cycle on three different levels. The player must use the handle bars controller to accelerate the motor and jump over buses. The pong games are Tennis, Hockey, Squash and Practice. All games are in color.
title: TV Fun: Color Model 901

description: TV Fun: Color Model 902 is a dedicated console that combines two chips by general instruments, the AY-3-8603 and AY-3-8765. This allows the console to play four variations of motocross and two car racing games. The motocross games use a side view showing the motor cycle on three different levels. The player must use the handle bars controller to accelerate the motor and jump over buses. The car racing games have vertical scrolling and require the player to use the wheel shaped paddles to dodge other traffic.
title: TV Fun: Color Model 902

description:
The PlayStation Classic Mini, is a miniature replica of the classic PS-One system with 20 pre-installed games running on emulation software, with the option to save data only. 12 games were the same at all the available regions (PAL, NTSC & NTSC-J), with the remaining 8 games differing from the NTSC/PAL region versus the Japanese NTSC-J region version.

USA (NTSC) & Europe/Australia (PAL) specific:

  • Cool Boarders 2
  • Destruction Derby
  • Grand Theft Auto
  • Oddworld: Abe’s Oddysee
  • Rayman
  • Syphon Filter
  • Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six
  • Twisted Metal

All Regions (NTSC, NTSC-J, PAL):

  • Battle Arena Toshinden
  • Final Fantasy VII
  • Intelligent Qube
  • Jumping Flash!
  • Metal Gear Solid
  • Mr. Driller
  • Persona: Revelations
  • Resident Evil: Director's Cut
  • R4: Ridge Racer Type 4
  • Super Puzzle Fighter II Turbo
  • Tekken 3
  • Wild Arms
title: Sony PlayStation Classic

description:
APF: TV Fun - Model 442 is a dedicated console playing four variations of Pong:

  • (Table) Tennis
  • Hockey/Football
  • Squash
  • Singles Handball

Aside from handball, all games require two players. Three switches on the device determine bat size, ball speed and deflection angle. The game is controlled using the two cylindrical paddles. While featuring the same games as the APF: TV Fun - Model 401 it's built using a different chipset: the TMS-1955N.
title: APF: TV Fun - Model 442

description:
APF: TV Fun - Model 444 is a dedicated console playing four variations of Pong:

  • (Table) Tennis
  • Hockey/Football
  • Squash
  • Singles Handball

Unlike the APF: TV Fun - Model 442 this console allows play for up to four players. Two of the players use the paddles on the console itself and two others can use the wired ones. Three switches on the device determine bat size, ball speed and deflection angle. The game is controlled using the two cylindrical paddles. It's built using the Texas Instruments dedicated pong chipset TMS-1955N.
title: APF: TV Fun - Model 444

alternate_titles.description: Hanimex European release (black and white version)
alternate_titles.title: Model 8881 Colour TV Game

description: TVG SD-01 is a dedicated console that looks like the TV Scoreboard: 2&4 Player Plus Target at first glance, but uses the more common AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip instead. Otherwise it features the same games: Hockey/Football, Two player Handball, One player Handball, Tennis and two target shooting games.
title: TVG SD-01

description: SD-081is a dedicated console playing ten games. The console uses the AY-3-8610 dedicated pong chip which features the following games: Tennis, Hockey, Soccer, Squash, Practice, Gridball, Basketball, Basketball Practice, Two player target, Single player target. Paddles move both up/down and left/right.
title: SD-081

description: Bi.Bip 100 is a dedicated console playing two shooting games, four racing games and four Pong variants. The console combines the AY-3-8500 with the AY-3-8760 dedicated chips. The games are: Tennis, Soccer, Squash, Practice, Rifle Game 1 and 2, Stunt Cycle, Drag, Motocross and Hurdle. The console offers settings for automatic serving, deflection angle, ball speed, paddle size, race speed and difficulty.
title: Bi.Bip 100

description: Tele-Sports is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants. The console uses the AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip and features the following games: Tennis, Squash, Soccer and Practice. Settings allow for manual or automatic serve, ball speed, deflection angle and paddle size. Scoring is held manually on the device using sliders.
title: Tele-Sports

alternate_titles.title: Colour TV Game: Model A TVG-20C

description: 9012 is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants and two target shooting games. The console uses the AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip and features the following games: Tennis, Squash, Soccer, Practice and two target shooting games. Settings allow for manual or automatic serve, ball speed, deflection angle and paddle size. Scoring is held manually on the device using sliders. Visually it looks similar as the 9008.

SC Eight Thousand is a dedicated console playing 6 Pong variants and two target shooting games for up to four players. The console uses the MPS-7600-001 dedicated pong chip. The games are: Target shooting (one and two player variants), Squash (one and two player), Tennis (two and four player) and Hockey (two and four player). There is on-screen scoring but score sliders on the device can be used to keep score beyond different game modes. Settings include automatic or manual serve and a difficulty setting for each player.
title: SC Eight Thousand

description: NV1001 Video Game is a dedicated console playing eight Pong variants and two target shooting games. The console uses the AY-3-8610 dedicated pong chip which features the following games: Target Shooting 1, Target Shooting 2, Gridball, Basketball, Hockey, Football, Tennis, Squash, Practice 1 and Practice 2. Settings allow for manual serve, bat size, ball speed and audio on or off. Instead of a joystick this console uses two sliders, one for horizontal and one for vertical movement.
title: NV1001 Video Game

description: Gamatic 7704 is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants. Ostensibly the same as the Gamatic 7600, but this uses the General Instruments AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip instead.
title: Gamatic 7704

description: TV Game is a dedicated console featuring four Pong variants and two target shooting game. It's identical to the Odyssey 3000 except it allows play of all the AY-3-8500 games.
title: TV Game

description: SD-062 TV-18 is a dedicated console that features 14 game modes. The console combines the AY-3-8610 and AY-3-8760 chips to provide the following games: Squash, Practice, Basketball, Basketball Practice, Tennis, Target Single, Target Twin, Gridball, Soccer, Hockey, Motor cross, Enduro, Drag Race and Stunt Cycle. The pong games have settings for manual or automatic serve, ball speed, and pro/amateur setting for both players. The motocross games have two difficulty levels.
title: SD-062 TV-18

description: TVG SD-04 BN is a black and white version of the SD-04. Aside from being in colour it also uses the AY-3-8600 chip instead of AY-3-8610, meaning it misses the two target shooting games, leaving only eight games: Basketball, Basketball Practice, Squash, Practice, Tennis, Soccer, Hockey and Gridball.
title: TVG SD-04 BN

description: Video Raceway is a dedicated console playing two top down racing games and four side view motocross games. The console uses the AY-3-8760 and AY-3-8603 dedicated chips. There are two different difficulty levels.
title: Video Raceway

description: 4 Sports Tele is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants. The console uses the TMS-1965N dedicated pong chip which features the following games: Tennis, Squash, Football and Practice. Settings allow for manual serve, enabling sound, ball speed, deflection angle and paddle size. Sliders on the device can be used to keep score between different games.
title: 4 Sports Tele

description: 8 Sports Tele is a dedicated console featuring eight Pong variants. The console uses the AY-3-8600 dedicated pong chip featuring the following games: Tennis, Squash, Practice, Basketball, Basketball Practice, Gridball, Hockey, Football. There are settings for manual serve, enabling sound, ball speed and play skill (professional or amateur). Sliders on the device allow for track keeping between games.
title: 8 Sports Tele

description: Super Color: Video X is a dedicated console playing three Pong variants and two target shooting games. The console uses the MPS-7600-001 dedicated pong chip. The games are Tennis (2 or 4 players), Hockey (2 or 4 players), Jaialai (1 or 2 players), Target shooting and Skeet shooting. Settings allow for manual serve and difficulty level for each team.
title: Super Color: Video X

description: Tournament Ten is a dedicated console playing eight Pong variants and two target shooting games. The console uses the AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip which features the following games: Tennis, Football, Hockey, Squash, Solo Squash, Basket Ball, Grid Ball, Basket Ball Practice, Skeet and Target. Games are played with joystick and settings allow for both players to switch between amateur or professional and two ball speeds.
title: Tournament Ten

description: Ricochet 8 is a dedicate console playing eight Pong variants. The console uses the AY-3-8600 dedicated pong chip which features the following games: Tennis, Hockey, Soccer, Gridball, Basketball, Squash, Practice and Basketball Practice. The games are in color and use are controlled with a joystick. The console uses the same two square blocks design as the Ricochet.
title: Ricochet 8

description: Heroic Tank is a dedicated console playing a tank battle game. Barricades on the battlefield don't stop the tanks, but do block shots. Tanks can shoot guided missiles and must avoid mines.

description: Colour Match: XK 500C is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants and two target shooting games. The console uses the AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip and plays the following games: Tennis, Hockey, Squash, Solo and two target shooting games. There are settings for bat size, ball speed and automatic serve. It features an attack feature where players can change ball speed and angle on the fly. All electronics of the console are inside the two controllers.

description: Olympian 2600 is a dedicated console playing eight Pong variants and two target shooting games. The console uses that AY-3-8610 dedicated pong chip which features the following games: Space Shoot, Soccer, Tennis, Hockey, Practice, Target, Gridball, Squash, Hoops and Basketball. Controllers allow movement in all directions and no light gun is used for the target shooting games. Settings allow handicap for left or right player.

The console uses the MM-57105N dedicated pong chip which features the following games: Tennis, Hockey, Handball. All games are in color and there are no further options.

description: Colormate DeLuxe is a dedicated console featuring three Pong variants and one target shooting game. The games can be played with two or four players (except practice which is for one player). The console uses the MPS-7600-001 dedicated pong chips which features the following games: Tennis, Squash, Soccer and Target Shooting. There are settings for manual serve and team handicap. The console is virtually identical to the Marume 2000 but implements a target shooting game from the chip instead of a practice game.

description: Marume 2000 is a dedicated console featuring four Pong variants. The games can be played with two or four players (except practice which is for one player). The console uses the MPS-7600-001 dedicated pong chips which features the following games: Tennis, Practice, Squash and Hockey. There are settings for manual serve and team handicap. The console was released in a red and a white casing. The console is virtually identical to the Colormate DeLuxe but implements a practice game from the chip instead of a target shooting game.

description: Saturn 5 is a dedicated console in kit form playing three Pong variants. The console uses custom logic and features the following games in its default configuration: Tennis, Ping Pong and Ping Pong and Hole. The last game inverts one of the bats to be a hole in a wall. The game is completely modular and allows for easy manual addition of on-screen scoring, sound effects and different game types.

description:
The Bandai Namco Flashback Blast! features eight classic Namco games:

  • Dig Dug
  • Galaga
  • Galaxian
  • Mappy
  • Pac-Man
  • Sky Kid
  • The Tower of Druaga

The system is completely self-contained in an HDMI dongle and uses wireless controllers for gameplay. While the system only includes one controller, separate ones are available separately.

The device also features a rollback save state system, which allows you to rewind your game up to seven seconds in the past so you can get out of some sticky situations - or just save your game progress to resume later.
