alternate_titles.title: The Amazing Spider-Man and the Masked Menace

description: Spider Sense Spider-Man and the Masked Menace is a dedicated plug and play console that contains a side scrolling platform game. The game stars with the player having to go after an imposter who is committing crimes as Spider-Man. Each level simply involves fighting off numerous enemies and reach the exit. In addition to movement, three buttons are used: one for punching, one for jumping and one for firing a web shot. The jump and web button can be combined to web swing. To progress through the game Spider-Man has to use his spider sense to locate necessary keys. Crates or enemies that hold keys therefore appear as yellow in the game. Additionally there are coins that can be collected for extra points.
title: Spider Sense Spider-Man and the Masked Menace

description: Code Name: Sector is a dedicated game in which one through four players track a hidden submarine. The computer controls the submarine, which is located in a grid and can move only a single tile after each ship's turn. Players use crayons and a parallel ruler to plot out paths and plastic submarines to keep score. The players' ships can change direction and speed and the computer will display their location and the proximity to the submarine using a LED display. Players use this information to deduce the position of the submarine and fire at it by giving a direction and range. When firing the player must also guess at the depth of the submarine or the shot will miss. On a miss, the submarine moves in a random direction.
title: Code Name: Sector

description: Computer Backgammon is a dedicated backgammon game with a built in LED display. The player can play the classic board game against the computer. The device uses an Intel 8048 processor. An actual board is depicted on the device on which the player moves pieces. The actual moves are entered with a keypad and the computer's moves are shown on the display.
title: Computer Backgammon

description: Nemesis7 is a dedicated console sold in assembled and kit form. The console plays the game of Nim. Two players can compete against each other or one player can play against the computer. On their turn, players take any number of pebbles from one of three columns. The player to take the last pebble loses the game.
title: Nemesis7

description:
Hi-Ten Bomberman was an experimental game playable at Hudson Soft Super Caravan events in 1993. It follows the traditional Bomberman mold, with the twist of pitting ten players against each other in large, widescreen playfields. It featured five gameplay modes:

  • Battle Royale: A standard deathmatch mode in which players compete to become the last bomber standing.
  • 2 Group Battle: Two teams of five players compete to eliminate the other team.
  • 3 Group Battle: Three teams of three players compete to eliminate both other teams.
  • 5 Group Battle: Five teams of two players compete to eliminate all other teams.
  • 1 vs 9 Battle: An endurance mode in which one unlucky player has to defeat nine other players.

This game ran on custom hardware and output a true 1035i HD image running on the Japanese Hi-Vision television standard. Although Hi-Ten Bomberman itself was never released commercially, its ten-player feature inspired the 10-player game mode from Saturn Bomberman.
title: Hi-Ten Bomberman

description: This update to Hi-Ten Bomberman was playable exclusively at 1994 Hudson Soft Super Caravan events. It updates the original game with a crossover cast drawn from other Hudson Soft games. Like the previous game, it ran on custom dedicated hardware and was never commercially released.
title: Hi-Ten Chara-Bomb

description: Belle is a dedicated chess computer. It plays a standard game of chess and features one of the best AIs from the late 1970s to early 1980s. Belle won the American Computer Chess Championship five times between 1978 and 1986. It won the World Computer Chess Championship in 1980.
title: Belle

description: Gammon Master is a dedicated console that pits the player against the computer in a match of Backgammon. The game uses the standard game rules and the AI knows various strategies which it will switch between to react to the player's plays. The game uses a small LED display to show the moves made, but features a physical game board in which the player can manually visualize the current game state, much like early chess computers.
title: Gammon Master

description: Gammonmaster II is a dedicated console that pits the player against the computer in a match of Backgammon. It's the successor of the Gammon Master. The game uses the standard game rules and the AI knows various strategies which it will switch between to react to the player's plays. The game uses a small LED display to show the moves made, but features a physical game board in which the player can manually visualize the current game state, much like early chess computers. New is the doubler feature which allows the player or computer to use the doubling cube to double the stakes of the game if accepted by the other player. If the other player doesn't accept that player forfeits that game.
title: Gammonmaster II

description: Checker Challenger is dedicated checkers playing device. The player can play checkers against the computer. A checker board is printed on top of the device and the player needs to manually move the pieces and input the move using the keypad. The Computer will then respond on the display with its counter-move. All the regular checkers rules apply.
title: Checker Challenger

description: MACC-1 is a Chess Challenger with improved AI. It is meant for advanced players. The game was both sold separately and available as a software upgrade to existing owners of the Chess Challenger. Particular improvements have been made in the endgame and difficulty settings can be adjusted mid-game. It's also possible to set-up chess challenges by starting from a custom board setup.
title: MACC-1

description: Solid-State Monopoly is a dedicated computer table for playing the board game Monopoly. Players input their actions using attached calculators and all game pieces have been swapped for LEDs inside the table that indicated the position of pawns, value of dice, number of houses on a property, etc.
title: Solid-State Monopoly

description: Boris is a chess computer running on a Fairchild F8 processor. It plays a standard game of chess and features a physical chess board to move the pieces on. Moves are input using a keypad and counter moves displayed on a LED display.
title: Boris

description: In virtual reality, the player freely flies through surreal spaces made up of words. Words float by like snowflakes, and make up the surfaces of the places that players travel through. The words, scribbles, and artwork the player encounters communicate different stories, with many different journeys possible through the space.
title: Chalkroom

description: CompuChess is a dedicated chess computer. The player can play chess against the computer. Moves are displayed on the LED screen and a numeric keypad is used to input moves. The device uses a Fairchild F8 processor.
title: CompuChess

description: CHESSmate is a dedicated chess computer. The AI programming is based on MicroChess and hardware based on the KIM-1 computer. A membrane keyboard is used to input the player's moves. The computer's moves are shown on a LED text display. A melody is played when the computer wins a game.
title: CHESSmate

description: Chess Challenger "10" is dedicated chess playing device. This upgraded version of Chess Challenger features 10 difficulty levels for the AI. Like its predecessor, a chess board is printed on top of the device and the player needs to manually move the pieces and input the move using the keypad. The Computer will then respond on the display with its counter-move. All the regular chess rules apply (e.g. en passant and castling).
title: Chess Challenger "10"

description:
T.E.A.M.M.A.T.E. or Total Electronic Advanced Microprocessing Maneuvers and Tactics Equipment is a dedicated console on which a number of games and activities can be played. The console features a keypad for input, a 4x4 LED display and a two character LED text display. There are different overlays for the 4x4 display for the different programs the device can run. It comes with 25 programs it can run some of which are games. The device has an educational approach to computing in general.

The following games and game-like activities are included:

  • Dice - Not a game but an electronic replacement for dice in any board game.
  • Tic-Tac-Toe - The classic game of getting three in a row, for two players.
  • Music - The device can both play back and record music that is keyed in.
  • Bleep - A Pong variant for two players, both must try to keep the ball, which travels randomly from side to side, in the field. The key corresponding with the position it will end up in must be pressed before the ball reaches it.
  • Bleep against the machine - As Bleep, but played against the computer.
  • To Catch a Thief - Not a game, but an activity which can be used in detective play to have a database of criminals to cross-reference against.
  • The Computer Bartender - Store cocktail recipes.
  • From Colors to Logic - Color mixing help.
  • An Elementary Calculator - A math exercise.
  • Music Chord - Identify chords.
  • The Computer Detective - Logic grid puzzle where a story is given and the player must use deduction to find the profession of various characters.
  • Doctor Logix - Medical diagnosis.
  • From La Paz to Buenos Aires - Game in which the player must give the cities the player must travel through to reach the destination.
  • A Translating Machine - The device translates a sample of given English phrases and sentences to French.
  • A Knowledge Test - Create your own four question test with two options for each question.
  • A Numbers Game - Players take turns to assign values to keys. The other player than has three tries in which two keys may be pressed, of which the score is totalled. The player with the most points wins.
  • Wheel of Fortune (Beginners) - Spinning wheel which gives a number when stopped.
  • Wheel of Fortune (Advanced) - Spinning wheel which gives a number when stopped. Players earn points and must hit a specific target amount of points, when overshooting it their score resets.
  • A Computer Weather Forecast - Weather forecast based on wind direction and barometer rising or falling.
  • Mini Checkers - Checkers on a 4x4 grid. When no more moves are possible the player with the most pieces on the other side wins.
  • NIM - A nim variant in which the play area is divided in three areas of 1, 5 and 10 lights. Players take turns turning off any number of lamps from a given area. The player to turn of the last lamp wins the game.
title: T.E.A.M.M.A.T.E.

description: Space Blaster: Electronic Projection Target Game is a console shaped as a stationary gun. Instead of a screen the target spaceship is projected onto the wall. The player must physically aim the gun and fire at the target to make it explode. There are multiple difficulty levels.
title: Space Blaster: Electronic Projection Target Game

description: Exec-U-Play: One Fingered Bandit is a very basic dedicated device that simulates a one armed bandit slot machine. The player presses a single button and led lights will light up on the three "reels" on the bell, fish or cherry. The player has to keep score manually.
title: Exec-U-Play: One Fingered Bandit

description: Star Wars: Electronic Laser Battle is an action game requiring quick reflexes for two players. Each player has two firing buttons and must match the correct button to destroy tie fighters. The first player to do so scores a point indicated by the LED lights. Once all six lights are lit up they have a chance at destroying the death star displayed in the middle of the device.
title: Star Wars: Electronic Laser Battle Game

description: Scrabble Brand: Lexor is a dedicated device that can both aid in scorekeeping for the Scrabble board game and play two games. Flash mode is a game for one to four players where players need to find as many words as possible from seven random letters before time runs out. Players alternate turns and whoever has the highest score wins. The device features a built-in word list, when the word is not in the list one of the other players can choose to allow or disallow it. Solo mode is a solitaire word game in which the player must try to make the highest value possible word from seven given letters, bonus points are awarded based on the length of the word. After fourteen turns the round ends and the score is final. Despite being called solo mode it's still possible to challenge up to three other players to beat your score.
title: Scrabble Brand: Lexor

description:

The BurgerTime Arcade Cabinet is a limited production series cabinet that includes four classic Data East arcade games with two sets of controls, it also comes with a custom riser with original artwork and a light-up marquee.

The included games are:

  • Bad Dudes
  • BurgerTime
  • Caveman Ninja
  • Karate Champ
title: Arcade1Up: BurgerTime Arcade Cabinet

description:
Arcade1Up Arcade Cabinets is a series of build-your-own arcade cabinet kits that include all needed parts to build a classic arcade system including the cabinet itself, arcade style artwork, a 17" LCD monitor and the appropriate controls.

The NBA Jam Arcade Cabinet is a limited production series cabinet that includes three Midway NBA arcade games with four sets of controls, it also comes with a custom riser with original artwork and a light-up marquee.

New to this Arcade1Up release is the option of online play via Wi-Fi, where players connect to an server to play other people anywhere in the world in games that were originally designed to be played locally.

The included games are:

  • NBA Jam
  • NBA Jam Tournament Edition
  • NBA Hangtime
title: Arcade1Up: NBA Jam Arcade Cabinet

description:
Arcade1Up Arcade Cabinets is a series of build-your-own arcade cabinet kits that include all needed parts to build a classic arcade system including the cabinet itself, arcade style artwork, a 17" LCD monitor and the appropriate controls.

The Golden Tee Arcade Cabinet includes four classic Golf games and a trackball, it also comes with a custom riser with matching artwork and a light-up marquee.

The included games are:

  • Golden Tee '98
  • Golden Tee '99
  • Golden Tee 2K
  • Golden Tee Classic
title: Arcade1Up: Golden Tee Arcade Cabinet

description:
Speak & Spell is a re-release of the educational spelling toy released in 1978. The gameplay is largely the same, with five modes that make use of a limited vocabulary of 200 words:

  • Spell - The system speaks a word and the child must spell it on the keyboard
  • Mystery Word - The child must guess a word in a hangman-style game with a limited number of tries
  • Say It - The child speaks and types in the word displayed on the screen
  • Secret Word - The system generates a secret code based on a word typed by the user
  • Letter - The system speaks letters out loud that are typed in

However, the technology underlying the system is slightly different, with the speech recorded and no longer synthesized, and the display is now an LCD, making it brighter than the original. Also unlike the original, the re-release cannot be expanded with additional cartridges.
title: Speak & Spell

description:
Capcom 3-in-1 is a dedicated console which contains three licensed ports of Capcom arcade games:

  • 1942
  • Commando
  • Ghosts 'N Goblins

sample_screenshots.caption: The main menu, where the player can select the three games.

title: Capcom 3-in-1

description:
Arcade Legends: Sega Genesis Volume 2 is a dedicated console which contains six ports of Sega Genesis games:

  • Sonic the Hedgehog 2
  • Alex Kidd in the Enchanted Castle
  • Columns
  • Ecco the Dolphin
  • Gain Ground
  • The Ooze
title: Arcade Legends: Sega Genesis Volume 2

description:
TVGames UltiMotion Fitness is a motion controlled plug & play console released by JAKKS Pacific in 2009. The system consists on a floor mat controller (with two central inputs, 2 up, 2 down, and one left and right, not too dissimilar to Bandai's Family Trainer controller) which the base unit is attached to, and two WiiMote-like motion controllers with no buttons other than a power button on each. The system connects to the TV using a composite cable with mono audio and is powered by 8 batteries (4 AAs for the base unit, and 2 AAAs for each of the motion controllers). The system includes a total of 6 games:

  • Circuit Train
  • Climb It!
  • Dance Workout
  • Knock Out Punch
  • Outdoor Training
  • Soccer Blocker
title: TVGames UltiMotion Fitness

description: Tennis Bausatz is an early dedicated pong console kit. Once assembled, two players can play against each other in a typical game of Pong; bouncing the ball with their paddles in an attempt to score a point. Paddles are moved up and down with a potentiometer.
title: Tennis Bausatz

description: TV-Tennis is a do-it-yourself dedicated pong console. The console was described with schematics in the magazine Elektuur/Elektor was the winner of a reader contest for interactive electronics. It plays a simple game of Pong for two players. Both players try to keep the ball in the field in an attempt to score a point.
title: TV-Tennis

description: Uitbreidingen TV-Tennis: Deel 1 is a set of schematics to improve on the do-it-yourself dedicated Pong console. Using the schematics the console can be upgraded to feature an AI player, a middle line, and limiting the play area.
title: Uitbreidingen TV-Tennis: Deel 1

description: Uitbreidingen TV-Tennis: Deel 2 is a set of schematics to improve on the do-it-yourself dedicated Pong console. Using the schematics the console can be upgraded to feature a "diaphragm" game mode where the ball needs to go through a hole in a wall and a soccer game mode with goals.
title: Uitbreidingen TV-Tennis: Deel 2

description: TV-Football is a dedicated console playing a Pong variant with goals. The console allowed play for two players and featured on-screen score keeping. The paddles can be moved both horizontally and vertically. It was sold pre-assembled or as a kit.
title: TV-Football

alternate_titles.description: TV model featuring the same games
alternate_titles.title: Arizona Color TS

description: Santiago Color TS and Arizona Color TS are two TV models that have Pong games built in. The games are Tennis, Hockey, Squash and Pelota, of which only the last can be played with a single player and the others with two. Settings allow changing the paddle size, deflection angles and ball speed
title: Santiago Color TS

description: Elektronisches Fernsehspiel is a Pong variant using the AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip. The game was released in kit form for manual construction and implements the following games: Tennis, Soccer, Squash and Pelota. The first three games are for two players, the fourth for a single player.
title: Elektronisches Fernsehspiel

description: 10 TV-Spiele Bausatz is is a dedicated console sold in kit form for manual assembly. It uses the AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip to play the following games: Tennis, soccer, squash, pelota (squash for a single player), and two target shooting games.
title: 10 TV-Spiele Bausatz

description: Sensor-Tele-Spiel TS 611 is a dedicated console sold in kit form for manual assembly. The console uses the AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip and plays tennis, soccer, squash, pelota (single player squash), and two target shooting games.
title: Sensor-Tele-Spiel TS 611

description: PAL-Spel is a Pong variant using the MM57105 dedicated pong chip. The chip is designed for PAL systems and uses color graphics for the game. This console was released as a do-it-yourself schematic for manual assembly. Game modes include tennis, soccer and squash.
title: PAL-Spel

description: CompuChess: The Second Edition is a dedicated chess computer. The device is very simple and features a keypad to input moves and a LED display showing your and the opponents moves in chess notation. Like the first edition. there are six skill levels for the AI to play against. What makes it unique are two unique game modes deviating from the rules of chess. One mode allows the queen to jump like a horse, the other changes all pieces except the king and pawns to horses. To round it all off there are 1500 chess puzzles to solve.
title: CompuChess: The Second Edition

description: Chess Challenger 3 is a dedicated chess computer. It features a physical board, keypad for inputting moves and LED display showing the computer's moves. The three in the title refers to the three difficulty levels provided for the AI.
title: Chess Challenger 3

description: Chess Challenger Voice is a chess computer based on the Chess Challenger 10. What separates it is that the game uses synthesized vocals to announce the move, in addition to showing it on the display. Later releases included some improvements to the AI such as dealing with a stalemate. The game was available in English, French and German.
title: Chess Challenger Voice

description: Chess Challenger 7 is the successor to the Chess Challenger 10. This chess computer has only seven difficulty levels instead of the ten of its predecessor and features some optimizations to the search tree to make it faster.
title: Chess Challenger 7

description: Bridge Challenger is a dedicated device used to play the card game Bridge. It can be used to substitute a real partner or play as both a partner and the opponent. It comes with a special deck of cards and and a scanner to allow the device to play along when playing with physical cards. Moves are displayed on a small VFD display and information can be inputted using two large keypads. The device uses a Zilog Z80 and Intel 8041A processor. It uses voice synthesis to speak out moves and bids.
title: Bridge Challenger

description: Scrabble Brand: Sensor is a word game that uses the Scrabble license. The game itself plays more like Mastermind, but with words. One player enters a secret word and others must guess letters to receive hints from the device. It's also possible to guess one of the words from the computer's own word bank. Hints are shown using a series of LEDs.
title: Scrabble Brand: Sensor

description: Mini-Vid: Breakfree is a tabletop video game for up to two players. It contains three game variants, all Breakout variants. The first two are for a single player and require the player to use their paddle to bounce a ball towards the top of the screen in an attempt to destroy all blocks. The difference between the modes is the difficulty. The third game mode is a two player version. The players bounce the ball back and forth trying to destroy each other's bricks. The first person to lose all bricks loses the game.
title: Mini-Vid: Breakfree

description: Mini-Vid: Dodge City Gunfight is a dedicated tabletop videogame which pits two players against each other in a wild west gun fight. There are three different game modes, generally players can move left and right to reposition and fire at the enemy in an attempt to hit them.
title: Mini-Vid: Dodge City Gunfight

description: Mini-Vid: Sea Battle is a dedicated tabletop videogame which pits two players against each other. There are three different game modes, they all play similar, but one is faster than the other and the other allows playing against the computer instead of another player. The controls allow movement left and right and firing. Players can control a submarine or a destroyer and fire at each other with torpedoes and depth charges respectively.
title: Mini-Vid: Sea Battle

description: Mini-Vid: Spacewar is a dedicated tabletop videogame which pits two players against each other. There are three different game modes, they all play similar. Both players control a space ship and use the buttons on the device to fire and move left and right.
title: Mini-Vid: Spacewar

description:
Wizard is a tabletop electronic game with a simple LED display. The device can play four different games for 1 to 4 players. Each game has three game variants.

  • Hot Corners has four players defend their corner of the game area from an attacking red light. Variants allow for a two player game or a three versus one version called "King of the Hill".
  • Match Me is a variant of Simon Says. Game modes allow for up to four players.
  • Music Maker is not a game but a tool to make music using the device's speaker and a 30 note memory which can be played back.
  • Break Out turns the play area into a maze. Players take turns and must try to escape, but the paths are hidden and making a wrong move ends their turn. The game can be played solitaire or with multiple players. Another variant ends each turn after a single move regardless of it being correct.
title: Wizard

description: Super Motocross is a dedicated console playing a stunt motocross game. The game has four different modes: stunt (jump over buses), race, obstacle (jump over hurdles) and motocross (combining the elements of all of the other game modes). All modes can be played in amateur or professional mode. The game uses the AY-3-8760 dedicated chip and thus plays identical to other consoles using that chip such as Atari's Stunt Cycle dedicated console. But this version uses paddles instead of a steer.
title: Super Motocross

description: Game 2000 is a dedicated console playing four Pong variants. The game uses the AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip and implements all the paddle and ball games: Tennis, soccer/hockey, squash and pelota. Settings allow for different bat size, ball speed and deflection angle. The console consists of two rectangular controllers and looks identical to the Hide-Away TV Game, all the electronics are hidden inside the controllers. A light-gun can be purchased separately to unlock the two target shooting games also available on the AY-3-8500 chip.
title: Game 2000

description: Computer Bowling is a tabletop game that simulates the game of bowling. Bowling pins are displayed with LED lights at the top of the device and the ball is shown as LED at the bottom of the screen, moving back and forth horizontally. The player must "roll" the ball at the right moment, when it can be seen moving up the lane and knock down a number of pins. Everything is accompanied with sounds and score is displayed at the top of the device using more LED lights. The game can be played solo or with two players taking turns. Normal bowling rules apply when it comes to scoring.
title: Computer Bowling

description: Pro Action Baseball is a dedicated tabletop game for one or two players. When pitching the move is entered from behind an obscuring panel so that the other player cannot see the move played. The batting player simply has to decide to hit or not. The simple LED display plays out the results on the field and score is kept on a separate LED counter.
title: Pro Action Baseball

description: Pro Action Football is a dedicated tabletop game for one player.The game works similar to Mattel Electronics' Football II. The player can move in four directions and can pass or kick the ball. The display consists of a simple grid of LED lights indicating the position of the players on the field. Score is displayed in separate bar above the field
title: Pro Action Football

description: Pro Action Soccer is a dedicated tabletop game for one player. The player can move in four directions and can pass or kick the ball. The display consists of a simple grid of LED lights indicating the position of the players on the soccer pitch. Only half the field is displayed on device with plays consisting of a single attack. Score is displayed in separate fields above the field.
title: Pro Action Soccer

description: Pro Action Basketball is a dedicated tabletop game for one player. The player can move in four directions and can pass or shoot the ball. The display consists of a simple grid of LED lights indicating the position of the players in the court. Only half the court is displayed on device with plays consisting of a single attack. Score is displayed in separate fields above the court.
title: Pro Action Basketball

description: Omar II is a physical game of Backgammon featuring a calculator-like device that can be used to input moves and play against an AI player, fictionally represented by renowned actor and Bridge player Omar Sharif. The LCD display of the device shows the dice rolls and moves of the opponent. The player has to manually move the pieces on the case board which features a board made of corduroy textile and leather. Physical dice are also included for players that wish to play without the computer aid.
title: Omar II

description: Baseball or Electronic Stadium Baseball is an electronic tabletop game which uses LED lights to indicate the position of baseball players on the pitch. A raised scoreboard shows the score, inning and number of outs. The game can be played with one or two players and is controlled with four buttons controlling the pitch and batting.
title: Baseball

description: Star Wars: Electronic Battle Command is an officially licensed Star Wars game in which up to four players engage in dogfights with TIE Fighters. Players fly their X-Wing Fighter and must avoid space wrinkles and black holes. Players have force units which represent their life and can land on planet Magna to replenish it. The last player to remain alive wins the game.
title: Star Wars: Electronic Battle Command

description: Boxing: Knock-Em Out is a dedicated tabletop game in which one or two players can compete in a boxing match. The boxers are displayed on the screen and the player's control their actions with their keypads with six different keys with different moves. When playing against the computer there are two skill levels.
title: Boxing: Knock-Em Out

description: My Little Pony Grand Puzzleventure is a console packaged with a Puzzlemint brushable figure and accessories. The game focuses on Puzzlemint going on a puzzleventure around Ponyville to acquire all the puzzle pieces. The player acquires said puzzle pieces through a series of mini-games ranging from a rhythm game to a platformer with a set amount of points to collect.
title: My Little Pony Grand Puzzleventure
Arcade1Up: Big Buck Hunter Pro Arcade Machine

description:
Arcade1Up: Star Wars™ Pinball collects 10 Zen Studios Star Wars themed digital pinball tables in a 3/4 scale pinball cabinet with a 24" LCD playfield and a dedicated simulated LCD DMD screen in the backbox.
It also includes a plunger and haptic feedback via solenoids.

The included games are:

  • A New Hope
  • Han Solo
  • Battle of Mimban
  • Darth Vader
  • Boba Fett
  • Ahch-To Island
  • Masters of the Force
  • Star Wars: Rebels
  • The Empire Strikes Back
  • The Force Awakens
title: Arcade1Up: Star Wars Pinball

description: Splinter is kidnapped! Four turtles Leonardo, Raphael, Donatello and Michelangelo must save him.
title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Battle for the City

description:
Arcade1Up Arcade Cabinets is a series of build-your-own arcade cabinet kits that include all needed parts to build a classic arcade system including the cabinet itself, arcade style artwork, a 17" LCD monitor and the appropriate controls.

The Golden Axe™ Arcade Cabinet is a cabinet that includes five Sega arcade games with four sets of controls, it also comes with a custom riser with original artwork and a light-up marquee.

The included games are:

  • Golden Axe
  • Golden Axe: The Revenge of Death Adder
  • Shinobi
  • Altered Beast
  • Wrestle War
title: Arcade1Up: Golden Axe Arcade Cabinet

description:
Arcade1Up: Marvel Pinball collects 10 Zen Studios Marvel comics themed digital pinball tables in a 3/4 scale pinball cabinet with a digital playfield and a dedicated simulated DMD screen in the backbox.
It also includes an simulated analog plunger and haptic feedback via solenoids.

The included games are:

  • Spider-Man
  • Civil War
  • Wolverine
  • X-Men
  • Thor
  • A-Force
  • Ghost Rider
  • Venom
  • Fantastic Four
  • Fear itself
title: Arcade1Up: Marvel Pinball

description:
Arcade1Up: Attack from Mars Pinball collects 10 Williams pinball tables in digital from, converted by Zen Studios.
It comes in the form of a 3/4 scale pinball cabinet with a 24" LCD playfield and a dedicated simulated DMD LCD screen in the backbox.
It also includes a plunger and haptic feedback via solenoids.

The included games are:

  • Attack from Mars
  • Fish Tales
  • The Getaway: High Speed II
  • Junk Yard
  • Medieval Madnes
  • White Water
  • Red & Ted’s Road Show
  • Hurricane
  • Tales of the Arabian Nights
  • No Good Gofers!
title: Arcade1Up: Attack from Mars Pinball

description: TV Sport is a Pong variant that uses the AY-3-8500 dedicated pong chip. Four games are implemented: Tennis, Soccer, Squash and Practice. Each provides its own variant on the basic Pong rules. Players bounce a ball back and forth and lose point to the other player when missing the ball and letting it pass.
title: TV Sport

description:
AtGames Legends Pinball is a full height virtual pinball cabinet with a 32" LCD playfield and a 15.6" LCD backglass screen in the backbox.
It comes with a D-pad to navigate menus and includes a mechacincal plunger and haptic feedback via exciter speakers.
The platform comes a network option to connect to the internet for high-score sharing, multiplayer, updating and ArcadeNet games cloud streaming. It can also connect to a PC to be able to play PC based virtual pinball tables.

Included are 22 Gottlieb pinball tables in digital from:

  • Al's Garage Band Goes on a World Tour™
  • Big Shot™
  • Black Hole™
  • Bone Busters Inc.™
  • Cactus Jacks™
  • Centigrade 37™
  • Central Park™
  • Class Of 1812™
  • Cue Ball Wizard™
  • El Dorado: City Of Gold™
  • Genie™
  • Gladiators™
  • Goin’ Nuts™
  • Haunted House™
  • Jacks Open™
  • Lights... Camera... Action!™
  • Pistol Poker™
  • Rescue 911™
  • Teed Off™
  • TX Sector™
  • Victory™
  • Wipeout
title: Legends Pinball

description:
The SEGA Genesis Mini 2 is a miniaturized replica of the SEGA Genesis Model 2, with its more compact design. It includes a 6-Button Control Pad (although its also compatible with the original Genesis Mini controllers). The new hardware it contains can also play Sega CD titles.

It features the following titles.

  • After Burner II
  • Alien Soldier
  • Bonanza Bros.
  • Chelnov: Atomic Runner
  • Clay Fighter
  • Crusader of Centy
  • Desert Strike: Return to the Gulf
  • Earthworm Jim 2
  • Ecco the Dolphin (Sega CD)

  • Fatal Fury 2
  • Final Fight CD (Sega CD)
  • Gain Ground
  • Golden Axe II
  • Granada
  • Hellfire

  • Midnight Resistance
  • Night Striker (Sega CD)
  • Night Trap (Sega CD)
  • OutRun - has new music tracks
  • OutRunners
  • Phantasy Star II - contains a new "Easy Mode" and has an option for increased walking speed.
  • Populous
  • Rainbow Islands Extra
  • Ranger X
  • Ristar
  • Robo Aleste (Sega CD)
  • Rolling Thunder 2
  • Sewer Shark (Sega CD)
  • Shadow Dancer: The Secret of Shinobi

  • The Ninja Warriors (Sega CD)

As well as the above 53 games, there are 8 bonus games:

  • Devi & Pii - first release
  • Fantasy Zone - A first time Genesis port of the arcade version that includes a beginner's mode.
  • Space Harrier II and Space Harrier - has new sprite scaling
  • Spatter - A first time Genesis port.
  • Star Mobile - A first time Genesis port.
  • Super Locomotive - A first time Genesis port.
  • VS Puyo Puyo Sun - A first time Genesis port of the multiplayer mode of Puyo Puyo Sun.

The Japanese version removes some games and adds some others when compared to the international version.

  • Honō no Tōkyūji: Dodge Danpei
  • Magical Tarurūto-kun
  • Megapanel
  • Party Quiz: Sega Q and Party Quiz: Mega Q 2022 (updated versions of Party Quiz: Mega Q)

  • Popful Mail (Sega CD)

  • StarBlade (Sega CD)
  • Tenka Fubu: Eiyutachi no Houkou (Sega CD)

The Japanase version also has both the American version and Japanese version of Robo Aleste.
title: SEGA Genesis Mini 2

description: Computer Chess is a dedicated chess computer. It features an LED display and 16 buttons to type in the chess moves. There are five different difficulty levels and makes sounds when moves are made. It requires an external board and pieces to play.
title: Computer Chess

description: Chessmaster Chess System III is a dedicated chess computer. The player can play chess against the computer which serves to input and output the moves. In the base version, the actual pieces are physical and moved on a physical board. The console could be expanded with several peripherals: An LCD screen showing the board, a printer that would print the moves, a power pack for portable usage, a memory unit and a suitcase.
title: Chessmaster Chess System III

description:
Celebrating Sega's 60th anniversary, this 1/6 scale recreation of the Astro City arcade cabinet comes with 37 built in Sega arcade games, a 4-inch screen, joystick and six buttons. Optionally an external controller can be connected for two player play.

Available for the first time outside of arcades is Dottori Kun, a scaled down version of Head-On, which seemingly only exists because of Japanese laws that stipulate an arcade cabinet must be delivered with a working game (at the time selling bare JAMMA compatible cabinets was a significant part of Sega's business, hence the Astro City arcade cabinet)
title: Astro City Mini

description: This 1/6 scale follow up to the Astro City Mini comes with 22 vertically orientated arcade games built in, a 4.6-inch screen, joystick and six buttons. Optionally an external controller can be connected for two player play.
title: Astro City Mini V
